icp.algorithm.math

Class FirFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • icp.algorithm.math.FirFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFilter

    public class FirFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFilter
    Taken from http://ptolemy.eecs.berkeley.edu/eecs20/week12/implementation.html Impulse calculation and Bessel function taken from: http://www.academia.edu/4919182/The_Io-sinh_function_calculation_of_Kaiser_windows_and_design_of_FIR_filters
    Version:
    2.00
    Author:
    Jan Vampol (upgrade to version 2.00)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FirFilter

        public FirFilter(double Fa,
         double Fb,
         int sampleRate,
         int M,
         double ripple)
        Constructor calculates impulse response using setupFilter method. Then delayLine array is created with same length as impulseResponse filled with zeroes. This array will be filled with values while filter is running. These values will serve as values for next value. Magnitude of every value is determined by impulse response.
        Parameters:
        Fa - Lower frequency - must be lower than Fb
        Fb - Upper frequency - must be lower than sampleRate/2
        sampleRate - Sampling rate of VisionRecorder
        M - Lenght of impulse response
        ripple - expected attenuation of VisionRecorder

      • FirFilter

        public FirFilter()
        Default constructor with recommended values.

    • Method Detail

      • getOutputSample

        public double getOutputSample(double inputSample)
        Specified by:
        getOutputSample in interface IFilter

      • calculateImpulseResponse

        public static double[] calculateImpulseResponse(double Fa,
                                double Fb,
                                int Fs,
                                int M,
                                double ripple)
        Method for calculating impulse response of the filter. Calculation details can be found at: http://www.academia.edu/4919182/The_Io-sinh_function_calculation_of_Kaiser_windows_and_design_of_FIR_filters working example at: http://www.arc.id.au/FilterDesign.html
        Parameters:
        Fa - Lower frequency - must be lower than Fb
        Fb - Upper frequency - must be lower than sampleRate/2
        Fs - Sampling rate of VisionRecorder
        M - Length of impulse response
        ripple - Expected attenuation of VisionRecorder
        Returns:
        H Array with impulse response
